pli-tv-bu-vb-sk31:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk31:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk31:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were eating almsfood disrespectfully, as if not wanting to eat it. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk31:7.1: “‘I will eat almsfood respectfully,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk31:8.1: Almsfood is to be eaten respectfully.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk31:8.2: If a monk out of disrespect eats almsfood disrespectfully, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk31:9.2: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk31:10.1: The first training rule is finished.
